title: PM Harini calls for unity and compassion while working towards a better tomorrow
byline: Let us renew our commitment to act together as citizens, guided by unity, love, compassion, and responsibility, in pursuit of our shared dream of a better tomorrow, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated in her Christmas Day message.

title: Christmas Day cyclone greets remote Australian islands
byline: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of a tiny group of islands off the West Australian coast today.

title: Pope Leo calls for kindness to strangers and the poor in Christmas message
byline: Pope Leo has told Christians that the Christmas story should remind them of their duty to help the poor and strangers.

title: Few showers predicted in several areas of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in Uva province and in Ampara, Batticaloa, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Avoid extravagance and share this Christmas with the poor - Cardinal
byline: Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith has called to avoid all forms of extravagance and celebrate this year’s Christmas in a humble fashion.

title: Let us renew our humanity through compassion and bring joy to every home this Christmas – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has urged all Sri Lankans to rise together as a nation to face the present with courage and unity.

title: Bethlehem celebrates first Christmas in three years
byline: Celebrations are resuming across the West Bank as a fragile truce holds in the Gaza Strip, where hundreds of thousands of people are facing the winter in makeshift tents and remain in urgent need of basic assistance.

title: Law to be strictly enforced against individuals who violate environmental regulations
byline: Law will be strictly enforced against individuals who violate environmental regulations, police stated.

title: Inmates granted special visitor access on Christmas Day – Prison Commissioner
byline: Inmates in all prisons across the island have been granted a special opportunity to meet visitors today (25) in view of Christmas Day, prison authorities said.

title: Police obtain detention orders to question suspects arrested in southern seas with large haul of narcotics
byline: The Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) has taken steps to obtain seven-day detention orders for the suspects arrested in connection with a stock of narcotics discovered on a multi-day fishing vessel by a group of Sri Lanka Navy officers off the southern coast.

title: Amazon Web Services servers crash on Christmas, several websites down
byline: Several reports claim that the Amazon Web Services servers have crashed on the intervening night of Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

title: Friends and The Middle actor Pat Finn dies aged 60
byline: US actor Pat Finn, who appeared in popular TV shows including Friends, Seinfeld and The Middle, has died aged 60.

title: T-56 assault rifle and ammunition found in Grandpass
byline: A T-56 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition have been found on a plot of land in 60-Watta, Grandpass, police stated.

title: Boxing Day sales set to be biggest on record this year
byline: Australians are forecast to spend $1.6bn in the sales on Boxing Day as the consumer regulator warns shoppers that even major retailers use deceptive sales tactics.

title: Sri Lanka can rise again as a strong, just and humane nation – Opposition Leader
byline: Christmas 2025 reminds us not only of what we have lost, but also of what we have not lost within ourselves, our compassion for one another, our willingness to stand together, and our faith in hope for tomorrow, stated Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa in his Christmas Day message.

title: 17 feared dead after bus catches fire in India’s Karnataka
byline: A horrific road accident on National Highway-48 in Chitradurga in India’s Karnataka has left at least 17 people feared dead after a private sleeper coach bus caught fire following a collision with a lorry.

title: Let’s renew humanity through compassion and bring joy to every home this Christmas – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has urged all Sri Lankans to rise together as a nation to face the present challenges with courage and unity.

title: King Charles III picks Westminster Abbey as the site of his Christmas Day broadcast
byline: King Charles III has chosen Westminster Abbey as the site of his Christmas Day speech on Thursday, reflecting the idea of pilgrimage that is expected to be a theme of the annual address to the United Kingdom and the Commonwealth.

title: Sri Lanka can rise again as strong, just and humane nation – Opposition Leader
byline: Christmas reminds us not only of what we have lost, but also of what we have not lost within ourselves, our compassion for one another, our willingness to stand together and our faith in hope for tomorrow, stated Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa in his Christmas Day message.

title: NORAD tracks Santa’s Yuletide sleigh ride for 70th year
byline: Santa Claus drove his reindeer-powered sleigh over rooftops around the world on Wednesday, delivering gifts to millions of children in a magic Christmas Eve ritual that North American air defense officials say they began tracking 70 years ago.

title: 14 people hospitalized after bus overturns in Serunuwara
byline: A total of 14 individuals have sustained injuries after a bus veered off the road and overturned in Serunuwara this morning (25), police stated.

title: Christmas is a time to reflect on teaching of Jesus on love and forgiveness –Dilith
byline: The noble qualities revealed by Jesus Christ should guide both our personal lives and our collective national life which have contributed to the progress of human society, the leader of the Sarvajana Balaya, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera stated in his Christmas Day message.

title: Public urged to help those affected by recent calamities during festive period
byline: It is appropriate to celebrate this year’s Christmas differently than usual, by helping those affected by recent calamities, said Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri chapters.

title: Nearly 30,000 individuals subjected to inspection during island-wide police operation
byline: A total of 597 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (24).

title: Health Minister chairs special discussion on expanding drug quality testing mechanism
byline: A special discussion was held under the patronage of the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, focusing on expanding and strengthening the process of maintaining drug quality standards.

title: Hikkaduwa UC budget defeated for the third time
byline: The budget of the Hikkaduwa Urban Council, which is under the control of the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated for the third time.

title: Reckless driver defying police orders crashes vehicle in Jaffna
byline: The driver of a car that failed to comply with police orders was involved in an accident while being pursued by police near the Mooththanainaar Kovil in Jaffna.

title: Sri Lanka Aviation Unit rescues two injured UN personnel in CASEVAC mission
byline: The Sri Lanka Aviation Unit operating under the United Nations (UN) mandate in the Central African Republic (CAR) has successfully carried out a critical Casualty Evacuation (CASEVAC) mission on 15 December 2025, under extremely hostile and volatile conditions.

title: Special access to visit inmates on Christmas Day – Prison Commissioner
byline: Inmates in all prisons across the island have been granted a special opportunity to meet visitors today (25) in view of Christmas Day, prison authorities said.

title: Police seize more than 2,300 firearms, over 23,000 kg of narcotics so far this year
byline: Sri Lanka Police have seized a total of 2,341 firearms during special search and raid operations conducted island-wide since 01 January 2025.

title: Excessive commercialization has overshadowed core values associated with Christmas – Cardinal
byline: The commercial economy has gradually transformed Christmas into yet another occasion focused on financial gain, rather than its true spiritual meaning, the Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith has stated.

title: China says it hopes firms seek lawful, balanced solutions over TikTok deal
byline: The Chinese government would like to see companies reach solutions that comply with Chinese laws and regulations and balance the interests of all parties, a commerce ministry spokesperson said on Thursday when asked about the hand-over of TikTok’s U.S. operations.

title: National Safety Day observance at Peraliya Tsunami Memorial tomorrow
byline: The main national commemoration of National Safety Day is scheduled to be held tomorrow (26) from 8.30 a.m. to 11.00 a.m. at the Peraliya Tsunami Memorial in Galle.

title: Health Minister chairs discussion on expanding drug quality testing mechanism
byline: A special discussion was held under the patronage of the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, focusing on expanding and strengthening the process of maintaining drug quality standards.

title: Nearly 30,000 individuals subjected to inspection during police operation
byline: A total of 597 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (24).

title: At least 30 injured in bus–tipper truck collision in Handapangodella
byline: At least 30 individuals have been hospitalized following a head-on collision between a tipper truck and a private bus on the Dikwella–Beliatta Road in the Handapangodella area, police said.

title: India tests K-4 missile, with 3,500-km range, from nuclear-powered submarine
byline: In a big flex of its nuclear capabilities, India has tested an intermediate-range ballistic missile launched from a nuclear-capable submarine.

title: Gampaha Crimes OIC arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Crimes Division of the Gampaha Police Station has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with an alleged bribery incident.
